The prosciutto was carved right off a leg that sat on their counter - awesome! The burrata was just creamy enough. These items were served alongside 4 small pieces of toasted bread, gherkins, apple slices and rosemary salted almonds - yum.

The Moscone was great - the crust was delicious and did not suffer from the burnt bottom some pizzas do from a dirty oven. The toppings were aplenty and delicious. 

I would absolutely return, just bummed it's a unisex restroom. Practice your squats, ladies!
author: Kimmie B.

description:
Me and my wife, trying to recover from the jetlag from our flight in from miami needed an early dinner. Close to our hotel we found, thanks to yelp, this great little place. I would not recommend it for large groups due to the size of the establishment, but we sat at the bar and had a great time. Besides for the bartenders tacky looking shirt ( it was like bright neon blue), we had a great time. Happy hour was nice 5$ house wine, drink and beer from 4 to 8$ and the best little pork belly sliders i have ever had for 4$ each. We also split a great pizza that had (like all pies) a 2$ special before 6pm. (Came out to 11$)
Atmosphere 4/5
Food 4/5
Price 4/5
Give it a try
author: Philippe P.

description: I walked by Archive at noon on a Tuesday and it was packed, so I figured they must be doing something right! I walked inside and I was immediately greeted by Jessica. I sat at one of the barstools along the front window and I enjoyed watching people walk by outside. The atmosphere was lively and the decor was  warm with exposed brick and wood tabletops. Jessica was my server and I ordered the Mission Chicken Sandwich with a mixed green salad and a glass of Syrah. The restaurant was busy, but my wine was served promptly and my  food was delivered within 10 minutes. Jessica checked back with me right away to make sure everything was okay. The food was fresh and delicious! The sandwich was huge and I especially liked the chipotle aioli and the side of spicy pickles. The staff was friendly and I never felt hurried or neglected. I gladly tipped Jessica more than 20% because she deserved it.
author: Dan R.

description:
Great spot for happy hour in the financial district. Loved the sangria and even tho the beer selection is quiet small, they have some great beers on tap also.

We had two pizzas and I do love the creativity and the flavors. The combination of ingredients is great, however, I didn't like the crust, that was disappointed but loved the different ingredients combinations.

Loved the service! Bartenders and servers were súper. Definitely a great place to meet people. While there,  my friend and I got approached various times by super friendly and fun guests.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Love, love, love this place!!!  Super cool innovative wine based cocktails that baffle even a seasoned bartender.
I had the chicken salad-lots of textures, fresh and huge for the $-these guys nailed it!
author: Michelle J.

description: Pretty good place for Happy Hour! Delicious pizzas and wines at reasonable prices. The place is small so can get cramped quickly..the server are all super nice.
author: Mimi T.

description:
The pulled pork Sammy is heaven on a plate! Spent 4 hours sitting at a table outside on a lovely summer Friday.  We had 3 servers during our time there and they were all so attentive and kind.  The pizzas are perfect to split with a group. Their stemware collection is exceptional. . . We wish we could have taken them home with us! Guess this means we have to come back for more drinks! They even offered water for my dog to make sure he was hydrated. We'll be back fo sho! :)

PS the spicy pickles are to die fo!!!!
author: Jenny B.

description:
Come here quite often after work for HH.

Just some dam good pizza.

Also the charcuterie platter is pretty legit, go for the big one if you have enough people.

The drink prices are too bad either, par for the neighborhood.

They have a big screen TV up above the bar.

(they had these meat cones when the first opened, but they don't currently have them.... i hope they come back)
author: Steven F.

description: Archive Shmarchive. What crappy pizza.  The crust is really crisp but too light and tasteless.  Very close to how microwave pizzas taste.  Not very happy with it and since I'm not drinking their selection of non alcoholic drinks is pretty abysmal.  The vibe is cool but they need a new chef.
author: Mitch A.

description: I liked this spot. Pizzas were pretty good, and they had a decent selection of booze. Customer service was spot-on; those guys took good care of us.
author: John H.

description: Best mac and cheese I have ever had in my entire life. Amazing cocktails. Super friendly (and attractive) bartender hehe. I usually order the lucas pizza, mac and cheese, Tony Bennett manhattan, and/or the Cabernet - never disappoints.
author: Nicole P.

description: Incredible menu! Simple but delicious. I had the kale salad w/ white nectarines which was so fresh and natural I felt they had a garden out back. My husband had the Caesar salad and he loved it too. Chef Matt and the Owner spent time at our table and let us sample changes they were making on the menu. Good food, good atmosphere, good price! Tops in my book and well worth another visit or two or three...
author: Tara G.

description: Good food.. came in at 2pm .. ate at bar, ordered blt... friendly service, nice atmosphere... would recommend n revisit.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Another great find in SFO. Friendly staff. Highly recommend the cast iron shrimp appetizer! Pork sliders were pretty yummy too.
author: Lydia T.

description:
Extremely noisy after sundown. Went at 8. People less than a foot from me were screaming into each others ears. And into mine. 

We couldn't take our shake to go at the end of it. :(
author: Ryu K.

description: We live in the area and were looking for a quick bite to eat with our young son.  We weren't sure we could bring him in since it was a bar but I think since they served food we were fine.  Our waitress was super friendly and when we were going to order too much food she told us we should probably scale it back.  We ordered a pizza and salad and both were delicious.  I had a beer and would definitely come back for more drinks (without my son of course).
author: Blake B.

description:
I like this place a lot! It's a great spot to grab a drink with friends after work. I've been here several times and never been disappointed, and all the times I've been we've been able to find a seat pretty quickly.

My friends and I definitely enjoyed the selection of drinks, and each time tried something different and new. My favorite thing about this place is the food options. The social board (cheese, meat, crackers, and various nuts/spreads) is fantastic, and they really give you a generous amount. I've found in the past that other places tend to skimp on the cheese and meat, but here, we've always had plenty to go around and we've run out of bread/crackers first. They also have a good variety of cheeses, meats, spreads, nuts, and olives, which I appreciate as well.

We've tried the pizzas a few times and always enjoyed those as well. They have a good selection of pizzas with interesting and unique combinations of ingredients. In my opinion, this is the perfect place to meet friends for happy hour!
author: Rebecca S.

description: Exceptional service but disappointed by the food and drink in comparison with my expectations. Still a solid spot to grab a gourmet pie after work. They close early during the week but I am accustomed to New York hours!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Came here to have a little staff meeting with my employees.  The asparagus salad with feta was so delicious! 

Not to mention the staff was very on top of things checking on us frequently.

Ohhh and the dessert, melted in my mouth!  Thanks Archive, we will be back!
author: Christina B.

description:
Came here for HH and boy were we disappointed. The drinks and wine here was all fine, but we also ordered the cheese and charcuterie plates and those were beyond disappointing. These were clearly brought over from safeway - I mean the meat still had the creases from being packed in airtight plastic. The cheese just wasn't good, simple as that. Also doesn't help that our waitress didn't really know which cheese or meat was which and couldn't give us a run down.

I'll probably give this place another shot down the road and try the pizza here, but so far, really not a fan.
author: Maria G.

description: Just had an extremely well crafted Pastrami on Rye for lunch- sans Thousand Island dressing per my request, though they did put another spread that didn't have mayo in it. The pastrami had slightly crunchy borders that added to the entire flavor profile.  I will certainly be back to try some of the other lunch menu items.
author: F. M.

description:
Awesome place for happy hour! The owner put his heart into this place, including the small details. It's not your typical win bar either. The menu is very approachable and the crowd is fun. It can be loud at times, but it's not overbearing. 

Overall, it's a must go for anyone working in SOMA or those looking for a few drinks and snacks with friends.
author: Brandon L.

description:
We came for a lunch with a group if colleagues. Very nice and welcoming interior , interesting wooden bar and nice service. I was pleased by smiley waitresses. They didn't have a table for us so we ordered to take away.

That was the problem. I think we overwhelmed them with our offer, but they could have just warned us about the waiting time, which spoiled our overall experience. The sandwiches and salads looked nice. Side salads had a great sauce and an interesting combination of nuts and apples.

My pizza with mushrooms and white sauce didn't have much goat cheese on it and the crust took about half of the pizza. Tomorrow it will be a different spot!
author: Michaela P.

description: Noisy. Fun. Good California wines by the glass. Waitress was very friendly and took great care of us even on a busy Friday night.
author: Nancy F.

description:
The wine cocktails are UH-MAZ-ING. Chatted with the guy responsible for crafting them and he is an artisan. Completely worth a trip for just cocktails! 

The space is so great and the service is friendly and very attentive. Nice to get some East Bay vibe in the financial district.

A++, would cocktail again.
author: sparkle f.

description: Fun atmosphere and great staff!! I wish I tried the "Lucas"... I sat near the kitchen and I must have seen over a dozen of them ordered! Drinks were great too!! Summer of Love was very refreshing!!
author: Serena T.

description: Really good pizza-- had the margherita but would have tried many of their awesome combos. Truffle orzo Mac and cheese was perfect to share with four people. We tried this really smoky drink resembling a campfire mixed with an old fashioned - it was called a Tony Bennett. And the adult root beer was great. Good atmosphere, and the waitstaff are sweet and helpful. We were trying to catch batting practice at a giants game; the food came out fast and everyone was really sensitive to our time needs. Oh and their music selection was awesome!!!! Great classic rock.
author: Rachael S.

description: Went there for the first time Friday night and I had a dream about the pork sliders from this place. Laid back atmosphere. Great place to meet up for a drink and a bite. Shout out to the bartender Cameron, awesome bartender.
author: Eve D.

description: This place is highly over rated. Then again my wife and I are Italian and know food. The pizza was awful. Crust was tasteless and the topping also was tasteless and meek. We also had the Caesar salad and that too was limp and lacked any character. If that wasn't enough the service was slow. You can do much better elsewhere.
author: Ralph D.

description: Great little pizza shop with a reasonable happy hour menu from 3-6PM. Its a very small space, best for casual 1:1s. It gets pretty warm inside so great for a cold day. Servers a friendly and on top of it, my wine glass was never empty. $5 house wines, $1 beers and $2 off cocktails. No Sangria special but that won't keep me from coming back!
author: Meredith M.

description:
Came past this gem earlier in the week and was surprised to see something so nice in an area that can appear a bit blah. Decided to try it out for lunch with a coworker today and we were both impressed.

We each had a pizza, I the truffle and mushroom and she the pepperoni. Both were very good! The sauce on the pepperoni was amazing and the combination of roasted garlic, mushrooms, bacon and truffle on the other were just what I was looking for. The crust was thin and crisp on the edges. Very well cooked - one of the best pizza options in this area.

We didn't drink, instead opting for the ginger beer and rosemary lemonade. However, they did offer a great selection of wines and the cocktails looked interesting. We decided we would have to make another visit for happy hour ($5 cocktails and $2 off the pizzas)!

On top of drinks and pizza, they also offer sandwiches and salads - both looked great. Additional, the wait staff were very nice and the atmosphere was really well decorated. It got a little loud when crowded, but no more than you would assume for a space that size.

If you're in the area, STAY AWAY - I don't want to be greeted by long lines for lunch next time...
author: Joseph A.

description:
Drinks and food are good, but the service was horrendous. We brought a group here for a going away party. Strategically planned it in between their lunch and happy hour rush (2-4:30pm). 

The management was rude and glaring at us the whole time. There was nobody else at the restaurant, and he corralled us into a corner because he had to make room for "regular customers" - I'm sorry - but WE actually are regular customers who are ordering drinks and food. And there was NOBODY else there. 

I asked him if we pretended we didn't know each other if we could all get our own seats rather than people needing to stand around the table. He scoffed at me and continued to force 35 ppl in a space for 20. 

As I'm writing this, the manager just came over to our dwindling group of 10 people to clear off the tables and set them for their evening service. He tried to ask us to move to yet another table that is "more comfortable."  I said that we are quite comfortable and he said, "No, I'm asking you to move because it'll make it easier to set for the evening service."  

I'm not too proud to say that I made a scene - except the only ppl to witness it were my 9 coworkers and the wait staff - because NOBODY else is here!!!!

Curious to see how long this place lasts in downtown as a local hangout.
author: Tiffany L.

description: This place is amazing. It's like a high classy wine bar in a hole in the wall joint. The place is known for there 5$ happy hour wine specials which are bomb! I used to go here with my co-workers all the time and share fantastic stories about our day. The owner and staff are very friendly and always keep the vibe relaxing and fun. They have one of the best Pizzas I've seen when I'm pairing with it wine. Yea I know wine and pizza don't seem like they could go well but at these place I can proudly say I would recommend this to anyone who is in the area with co-workers, friends, or even families looking for happy hour wine bars.
author: Anthony C.

description: Really good gluten free pizza! Gluten free pizza is usually on a spectrum from cardboard to stick of butter and this was a happy medium - crispy, buttery, and really great for gluten free. Was a bit disappointed in their rosemary lemonade, which just tasted like lemonade, but overall was impressed and glad that I went.
author: Beth W.

description:
I came here with a group of coworkers wanting to spend some time together outside work. We got here shortly after happy hour started at 3 on Friday because we wanted to beat the after work rush. The place was completely empty but the waitress crowded the 9 of us into a table that seats 6-7, acting annoyed that we showed up at the end of her shift. We ordered some drinks and food and were subjected to some more indifferent if not downright rude service. After an hour, one person in our party left and another person used the empty stool to place their coat. Since we were huddled in a crowded table, there were just not enough hooks underneath. The manager immediately comes over and tells my friend to place his coat on his lap so the stool can be moved back to the bar, where again, no one was seated! We had planned on running up a big tab because the boss was paying but left before any after-work crowds came in, so we can't vouch for how crowded it might get. I don't understand why the management would want to foster such an unwelcoming environment. We were a courteous, professional group of people and were made to feel  like our business was not appreciated there. 

On a side note, the guy busing the table and the waitress who came in toward the end were pleasant but unfortunately the manager and earlier waitress set a bad tone for the establishment.
author: Mimi N.

description: Pizza is great! I had the margarita ! The salads are awesome! Cheese board is wonderful and service is great. Happy hour was just very limited choices. Small menu. It can get crowded. Great place for small groups.
author: Alison W.

description: The service was exceptional. A friendly and attentive staff. The food disappointed, though. Over mixed meatballs with no flavor. Flavorless Brussel sprouts with no seasoning. Apparently the best plan is to stick with the pizza.
author: Karen M.

description: The Hearst pizza with an egg, the pastrami sandwich, and Italian beef sandwich. Done.
author: Vina H.

description: I wanted to try out Del Popolo, but the wait was too long.  I had walked by this place a number of times and had been curious, so we decided to go there instead.  We ordered the squash pizza and margherita pizza, and a salad (and perhaps another appetizer that I've forgotten).  I think neither of us will be back.  I'm unclear how this place has such high ratings (for the pizza at least).  Neither of the pizzas were particularly good, and the entire meal was pretty forgettable.  Even though it's a pretty casual place, the food ended up being just as expensive as a lot of other places, but not nearly the quality.  It wasn't an awful experience, but I ended up being bummed that I'd come there and slightly guilty for suggesting it to my friend.
author: L C.

description: Nice find! Sat at the bar for lunch and had an amazing lime/mint cocktail (made with wine - no liquor here) and a pizza. Pizza was inventive (speck, asparagus and egg) crust was awesome. Friend had the pastrami; messy but delicious
author: Susan L.

description: So incredibly loud inside that I couldn't wait to leave. I recall having a good cheese plate while my eardrums were mutilated. The pizza was so-so.
author: Andrew H.

description: Great new find. The sandwiches are truly amazing.  Generous portions, chips and pickles, great salads and creative choice of tap brews.  Tables a bit cozy for private conversations and it gets a little loud during the lunch hour but still highly recommended.
author: BigRedsLover H.

description: This place is incredible. I have been there twice now, and have had a great experience both times. Not only is the food tasty and creative, but the service is above expectation. The best place to sit is at the bar when Matthew is working. You will know who he is immediately when you see his awesome mustache. I recommend this spot for lunch & wine inspired cocktails. It's amazing that they can create "cocktails" without actual liquor. Check it out for yourself!
author: Alexander C.

description: Was served  by Esteban, his service was absolutely great! Explained the menu and was very patient with me not being able to make my mind up. Great vibes, good music, and lovely drinks!
author: Joe F.

description: Split a pizza and downed a beer at lunch, great venue, whether after work or during the day a good place to gather with a couple of friends for a drink!
author: William B.

description:
I came in (lunch ) for the pulled pork sandwich but they don't have it until after 3pm

So I asked the bartender what's the next best and was directed to the mission chicken sandwich.   In a word ::: Grub 
It was a large sandwich and chock full of flavor(s) all of which were complimentary. Unknowingly I added on a side salad for  $2 more --- the salad had its own goodness with cheese pear cuke and tomato. ..

While I didn't have the pizza. .two different orders were devoured nearby....
Looking around,  no one was disappointed including myself!
author: Troy C.

description: Cheese plate is a steal. Three of us couldn't finish the plate. Salads are huge too but the star of the show just didn't shine. The pizza crust was thin, but a bit soggy. I'd come back here for a glass of wine but will skip the pizza next time.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Solid effort, but they need to do a little more logistical work with their pizzas.  The slice should not buckle under the pressure of too many toppings, but that is just what my Truffle Oil pizza did.  The Chicken Alfredo and Pepperoni my dining companions got seemed to fare a bit better.
author: Jeremy G.

description: An absolutely awesome environment, great food and very friendly owner and staff! Definitely a place to check out!
author: Kamelia I.

description: I work nearby and I find it's a good spot to grab a beer or glass of wine.  It's a relaxing atmosphere when it's not too crowded (but like all places in the area, it gets crowded at the normal lunch/HH hours).  The pizza is well made, too.  I also have tried the pickles which were tasty.
author: Ross I.

description: I love this place!  I eat here as often as possible.  Their sandwiches and pizzas are excellent, just the right size, and just the right price.  I'm a $10 lunch kinda guy, and getting that with quality in a cozy atmosphere and great drinks is tough to do in the city.  But Archive has achieved it, and with a friendly, knowledgeable staff as well.  The owners have been in the business for years at some very reputable places, so if you're not sure what to order, do hesitate to ask them, or any of the staff for that matter.  And despite not having a full bar, the drink menu never disappoints.  And you can walk to the ball park from there.  Give them a try next time you're in the area.
author: Von W.

description: Quick stop for lunch with a girlfriend; the bartender/server was super friendly and accommodating.  She had the Italian beef. I had the BLT. Mine was amazing. The bacon was cooked perfect and the avocados were superb. It was cooked to order and we were in and out in less than an hour.
author: Kimberly C.

description: This is right across from Cal Train station. So if you do not want to deal with parking and you want to go to a really hip place for a drink and nice meal you can hop on the train and just cross the street! The food is good very Farm to Fork and Organic-like. Reservations are HIGHLY recommended because this is a small establishment that gets crowded fast!
author: Christine D.

description: This place was great for their pizza, mixed drinks, and of course, beer!  I'd definitely recommend the Truffle Pizza.  I've never had this type of pizza before, but it was AMAZING!  Also, I'm never one to eat the pizza crusts, but the crusts here were so tasty.  It's quite busy here during happy hour, so it's hard to get a seat of 4.  Keep in mind that they don't have much seating, so come here early (4pm - 4:30pm) for happy hour if you want to seat a group.
author: Andrew H.

description: Great atmosphere, good food and drinks. Came here with a few mates after work- we caught the happy hour right before it ended at 6. $2 off regular prices. Had the DiMaggio pizza. Attentive and friendly staff, too.
author: Penny C.

description: Quick and good place to enjoy a refreshing and healthy way of having salad and pizza. The drinks are excellent and you can't beat the price. $$. I'm looking forward to trying everything on this delicious menu.
author: TJ U.

description: Went here with a few of my friends the other night, since we noticed it was now open. Very impressed with the ambiance, happy hour specials, and the owner was always present helping. I would recommend this to people looking for a new post-work bar/apps place.
author: Nataja L.

description: Nice little bar great drinks, tasty foods, convenient location for after-work drinks.
author: C D.

description: It's so loud here (despite not being overly crowded) that our waitress could barely hear our orders and it made it impossible to have a conversation across the table. The owners need to invest in some noise reduction paneling. Then we ordered the $12 Manhattan's which were the weakest/worst Manhattan's I've ever had (and I'm not picky about my Manhattan's). When we told the waitress that they weren't very good she didn't offer to replace them, just said ok and walked on to take an order from the next table. The Pizza's were good though!
author: Todd H.

description: The pizza here is great. The ambiance allows you to have engaging conversations.
author: Hari B.

description: Excellent selection of wines---the owner came by and offered up his recommendations to pair with our pizza and charcuterie. Great atmosphere and friendly staff!
author: Christina Y.

description:
(changed this from 2 to 3 since I've had about 4 good experiences and 1 bad)

I feel bad giving this place a bad review, because I've had some great food from here. 

But, part of being a great go-to place is consistency.

I used to order the Santorini salad w/chicken for lunch. At ~$15 it was a bit pricey, but it was special with the yummy cumin dressing, olives and pita chips. I used to be able to not finish this salad.

This salad is no longer on the menu, so I went with the mixed greens w/chicken.

In the past, I got twice the amount of chicken I got today (adding chicken = $4) -- which was really disappointing. The salad was sad. It simply was no way worth the cost - at all. Never, ever order it.

$15 less in my pocket now, and I need to step out to get a supplemental sandwich.
author: Kathryn A.

description: Small family business bar so you know they care about their reputation.  Friendly service and amazing pizza.  You can really taste the uniqueness of the tomato sauce that they use.  The Santorini Salad is a must try starter but the pizza is what will keep me coming back.
author: Alex G.

description: This place is legit. Our office's go to spot for lunch. Delicious sandos, seasonal salads with fresh fruit and/or veggies with chicken...mmmm...perfectly cooked thin crust pizzas with amazing flavors. Friendly staff and awesome service. I hit up Archive a minimum of twice a week!
author: Blake S.

description: Awesome ambiance? Check. Delicious freakin' food? Check. Great service? Check. This place is as good as it gets and is one of our go-to spots for lunch and happy hour. Awesome place to go after work for a drink (or two) with a group...always delivers.
author: Devon S.

description: Really delicious! Pizza was amazing with some of the best crust I've ever had. The salad was very fresh. They were delayed in bringing out our food so they gave us a 50% discount. Great service, great food.
author: Kellyn G.

description: Great location. Good sandwiches. I wouldn't recommend the pumpkin pizza as I think that the flavors/ingredients mixed together don't go very well. The service is decent.
author: Mimi S.

description: Update:  Went back to Archive today.  Arrived at 11:45 a.m.  Placed to-go order within 1 minute of entering (place was relatively empty).   A guy comes in 5 mins. later, places order and tells the bar tender he would be back in 10 mins.  10-15 go by; guy comes back for his order and he's out.  I sit, i have a glass of water.  i ask the bar tender to check on my order, now the place is getting crowded.  People who have come in far after me are picking up orders and leaving or even worse, being served!  I see in the distance, the person making the pizzas place a box on top of the oven and just leave it there.  Didn't think much of it.  10-15 min's go by, bartender says that my order should be up soon and that they had just put it in the last time he checked.  I wait some more, more people come in, order and leave.  By now, I'm asking REALLY??  Can you check on my order?  I say, "I saw the guy put a box on top of the oven 20 min's ago".  Bartender goes over, takes the box off the top of the oven, turns out it was my order.  He slides it across the bar without so much as an apology for the inconvenience and never even looks at me.  UNBELIEVABLE.  Service is as important as food quality.  Neither were good today.  I wish I can say what I'm really thinking but I don't want yelp to delete my post! haha!
author: RastaGirl J.

description: Yum a lum, lum, lum. And service on top of that was excellent. Best new treat I've found in a while.
author: S. N.

description: Really was impressed by this place. Despite it being crowded, the service was excellent. I ordered the chicken sandwich and it was really tasty and filling. Will definitely be coming back to try the pizza!
author: Rana B.

description: Wow. I used to love this place. Awesome salads, pizza, sandwiches etc. Today, I got served raw chicken. All 7 of us had ordered chicken and after 3 of us tasted my chicken, it was unanimous that my chicken was raw (the pink color and fact it was cold in the center did not help...). When we approached the waiter, he said that this is how they serve chicken. We told him that none of the other chicken tasted raw. He then retorted: 'maybe next time don't order the chicken'. Not only was the chicken raw, but they messed up on 60% of our order (adding chicken to a pizza when we asked for it on the side, serving chicken chunked on a salad when we asked them to serve it in strips on the side, not tossing in the dressing on the salad, adding anchovies to a salad we asked to have no anchovies...). And when we complained about our incorrect orders, we got nothing but bad attitude from the servers. So if you want to get food poisoning and awful service with the head waiter/(owner?) talking back to you, this place is for you! As for me, I will not be going back and neither will anyone in my company.
author: Izzi T.

description: Come see Kevin and the gang!  Great drinks and small plates.
author: Craig S.

description:
Great place all around!

Very cool decor, all around an antique ("archival") decor.  Good examples include subtle and cool lights and very cool glass votives that have old school slides of SF attached to them (so that you can see them with the light of the candle).

Had the homemade sangria which was a great mix of spicy and sweet with the right amount of fruit served in a cute glass.  My wife asked the waitress to just pick a nice white wine and her choice was great.

Definitely recommend the squash and arugula pizza.  Excellent cheese on top and perfect crispiness.  

Probably my favorite part is the owner, Kevin, who is both behind the bar but also checking on everyone to ensure everything is perfect.  Super nice guy who clearly is interested in everyone having a nice time.  

Parking on a Saturday night was close and secure nearby.

I'm definitely coming back.
author: Todd C.

description: Had dinner and drinks with a group of friends here last week, and had a wonderful experience!  The food is delicious (had a couple pizzas, and they were both fantastic!), and the fun, creative drinks were excellent (the owner makes speciality drinks). The ambiance was very 1920's antique- LOVED it!  Service was solid, and the owners are very kind and involved in the service- you don't find that too often anymore.  Two thumbs up for this new spot...can't wait to come back!!
author: Erika L.

description: Came here for dinner a few times. Their drinks are awesome and so is their food. The prosciutto and burrata cheese appetizer plate is a must! It's amazing - the best I've had so far. I also recommend their Cezar salad - I'm usually not a fan of this salad but it's great here - totally worth trying and I'm sure you won't regret it.
author: Alex M.

description: great pizza and the tony bennett cocktail was amazing
author: Steph L.

description: Great cocktails and pizza. Very reasonably prices. Friendly and attentive staff. Highly recommend for everyone. The winter sangria hit the spot on a cold night. Also really fun music.
author: B W.

description: Had the chicken sandwich and it was one of the best I've had in a long time. The place just recently opened, and they're still adding a few things (e.g. didn't have an espresso machine yet when I visited). The menu is very limited, but if everything is as good as the sandwich I had, they'll be a go-to place for our office.
author: Massimo A.

description: Good pizza.  Nice convenient place to recoup after the work day before commuting home!
author: Matt C.

description: Among the better Pizza places in the city, and offering good value for money. I am surprisingly impressed. For the Margarita, the use of corto oil, the perfect thickness of the crust, and liberal and evenly distributed fresh mozzarella are all much appreciated. SF has a LOT of bad pizza places, but this is not one of them.
author: S G.

description: Great spot for a HH. Mission St in FiDi definitely needed something like this, so it's a great addition to the HH spots. I enjoyed their wine - thought I'm not sure they were actually HH prices.... maybe I came too late. The pizzas were all great to share and made for great snacks. I'll be back!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Archive Bar & Kitchen in SF (Mission&2nd) is incredible. The food is original, simple and flavorful as hell. Don't sleep on the Caesar Salad, the anchovies are special with an olive oil and lemon twist. Pizzas are great, drinks plentiful and atmosphere is cozy. We met the chef (Matt), our server Dennis and the owner who made us feel special and really cared how our food and service was. This was our first time here and we'll be back. Great place, don't miss it, joe.
author: Joe G.

description: Great pizzas!! Had lunch at archive today...very busy, not a huge surprise considering it's location. The wait was a bit longer than expected...over 30 minutes from order to being served but well worth the it! I'll definitely be back just not at noon. Had the Classico and the white truffle pizza both amazing! A coworker ordered the mission street chicken sando and said it was great too!
author: James P.

description: My review is based solely on  my take out order.  I ordered the chicken sandwich, which looked good, but lacked flavor.  I understand chicken breast typically can be dry at times, but the chicken in their sandwich was extremely dry.  Dry to the point where if you don't have something to drink with it, you could possibly choke.  Also, the chicken had no seasoning, it tasted like a dry bland piece of nothing.  The bread was decent, and what visibly looked like aioli dressing, did not taste like it.  I was able to eat most of the sandwich and not taste a thing.  The pizza looked good, but I will not try it after eating possibly the worst sandwich Ive had in the financial district.  Definitely will not return for the food.
author: Ron R.
